abstract: Afghan government officials, majority of whom have lived abroad and have family in other countries, find their pleas for ordinary citizens to remain in country ignored; government efforts to stem mass exodus falters as war-torn country is increasingly destabilized.
lead_paragraph: The reality of a government in which many senior officials have families who live abroad has made it difficult for Afghanistan’s citizens to accept entreaties to stay home.

headline.main: Afghan Leaders Try to Halt Exodus, but Pleas Ring Hollow
headline.print_headline: Pleas Ring Hollow as Afghan Leaders Try to Halt Exodus

snippet: The reality of a government in which many senior officials have families who live abroad has made it difficult for Afghanistan’s citizens to accept entreaties to stay home.
